posts.name: Rajat Goel
posts.cooked:
Hi, i am facing a very strange issue with my TDS project 1, Its giving me the answer as correct to anything that i am putting, for example if i am putting in random string in text box then also i am getting it as correct

Screenshot 2024-10-21 at 9.37.29 AM2670×324 35.9 KB

Am i missing something?

@carlton can you please clarify?

link_counts.title: Bug in the evaluation algorithm for Project-1

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi Rajat,

Thanks for notifying. The instant feedback script might be non-functional for some questions. Please do not rely on it for the time being. When the actual evaluation is done (i.e. when you submit the answers with the big scary red button), it will be checked with a separate validated answer checking script on the backend.

Kind regards

posts.name: Rishit Pant
posts.cooked: Will reloading the page change questions for this project?

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
@22f3001210

You could just try reloading the page and see if the question changes? No?

Regards

posts.name: Rajat Goel
posts.cooked: Its happening with every question, how will we know if the answer is correct or not?

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
@22f3002293

Did you even read my reply?

The instant feedback script might be non-functional for some questions. Please do not rely on it for the time being.

How do you know if your GA answers are correct or not (like GA2, 3 ,4 etc).?

You have to make sure your logic is sound and you are answering the questions correctly. Check with your friends to see if everything is working as expected. Collaborate on finding solutions.

posts.name: Rajat Goel
posts.cooked:
carlton:

How do you know if your GA answers are correct or not (like GA2, 3 ,4 etc).?

In GA2,3,4 check answer button was working fine so i knew that my answers are correct before submitting.

carlton:

the big scary red button

When i am submitting it via big scary red button(which is actually smaller than the innocent looking green button) then also same thing.

Screenshot 2024-10-21 at 11.54.51 AM2638×794 149 KB

Do you mean to say we will get the correct answers only after the due date is over?
@carlton

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
22f3002293:

In GA2,3,4 check answer button was working fine so i knew that my answers are correct before submitting.

That’s very impressive because no other student, including the TA or the course instructors had that capability for GA2,3,4 … would have been very handy indeed! Please sir, do share with the rest of us how you managed to check your answers with the check answer button for those GAs!

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
22f3002293:

When i am submitting it via big scary red button(which is actually smaller than the innocent looking green button) then also same thing.

As I mentioned …

The instant feedback script might be non-functional…

Hence the score you see on the page, which a product of the instant feedback script, will not be reliable.

22f3002293:

Do you mean to say we will get the correct answers only after the due date is over?

At this point, I do not have an official answer to this question yet. So please follow the guidance that has been issued so far. In all prior terms, students never had the capability to check their answers before the submission (except through exploiting some loopholes of the portal submission system), so this feature is being trialled and is likely to have some bugs in its implementation for the time being.

posts.name: Rajat Goel
posts.cooked:
carlton:

exploiting some loopholes of the portal submission system

I am not asking for any unethical means, i am just trying to understand what is the use of check answer if its not not working. Anyways thanks for your help. Take care

posts.name: Anand S
posts.cooked:
@22f3002293 – thanks for flagging this. The issue is resolved.

What happened?

My code checks if the repository has valid values, and if not, sets the expected answers to random numbers to prevent guessing.

But (a) if we don’t submit a repo, it never gets to the second part, and (b) I didn’t test this scenario.

So, thanks for flagging this early!

There were 8 students who submitted partial results so far:

22f3002743@ds.study.iitm.ac.in
21f2000168@ds.study.iitm.ac.in
23f1003155@ds.study.iitm.ac.in
23ds3000248@ds.study.iitm.ac.in
22f3001210@ds.study.iitm.ac.in
22f1001615@ds.study.iitm.ac.in
22f3002293@ds.study.iitm.ac.in
21f2001119@ds.study.iitm.ac.in

I’ve deleted these entries (and mailed them). So everyone can now re-submit and hopefully things should work fine.

@s.anand Sir this issue is fixed but i am facing a new issue, i submitted 12 questions yesterday and the marks can be seen here.

Screenshot 2024-10-22 at 5.06.51 AM2672×864 182 KB

But today when i opened it again, the answers were gone, do i have to submit in one sitting only?

posts.name: Anand S
posts.cooked:
No @22f3002293 – you can submit in multiple sittings, no problem.

I manually deleted your answers at around 7:30 pm IST yesterday after fixing this and mailed you. So that was expected.

But your recent submission at around 1 am IST today is very much available and will stay available.

posts.name: Rajat Goel
posts.cooked:
Dear @s.anand Sir,

Please look at this video

drive.google.com

TDS.mp4

Google Drive file.

I have not made any changes after my last submission, but my answers are not visible when i open them again. So if i make the next submission i have to enter them again or it will take empty string as answer.

Is there something wrong with my understanding?

posts.name: Anand S
posts.cooked:
Ahhh… I understand. Thanks for sharing the video, @22f3002293

The submission is stored on the server. But the answers are not reloaded.

Fair point. It normally makes sense for them to be reloaded. But I’m going to think about this for a while, because

  • GA0, GA1, and a few upcoming GAs will have a DIFFERENT version of the questions on reload. We don’t want the answers to be reloaded there
  • Project1 and ROE will have the SAME version of questions on reload. We want the answers to be reloaded there

I need to think about the best way of differentiating between these kinds of tests. Give me a few days, please.

In the meantime, please keep a copy of your answers.

Thanks!
